meanings.sent1: She took precautionary measures before the storm.
meanings.sent2: It is always wise to be precautionary when dealing with fire.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's precautionary stash of acorns saved the day.
meanings.sent4: His precautionary instincts kicked in like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The precautionary warning sign glowed in the dark, a beacon of safety.

meanings.sent1: The team made precautionary changes to their plan.
meanings.sent2: Wearing a helmet is a precautionary measure for biking.
meanings.sent3: The precautionary decision to bring an umbrella paid off.
meanings.sent4: Her precautionary actions spoke louder than words.
meanings.sent5: The precautionary barrier kept the danger at bay.

meanings.definition: Taken in advance to prevent something dangerous or unpleasant
meanings.sent1: He made a precautionary call to avoid any misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed a precautionary antibiotic just in case.
meanings.sent3: The precautionary lock clicked shut, securing the valuables.
meanings.sent4: Her precautionary escape plan was flawless.
meanings.sent5: The precautionary evacuation saved lives during the flood.
